## Do something simple 

```{r}
x_vec = rnorm(30, mean = 5, sd = 3)

(x_vec - mean(x_vec)) / sd(x_vec)
```
I want a function to compute z-scores 

```{r}
z_scores = function(x) {
  
  if (!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("Input must be numeric")
  }
  
  if (length(x) < 3) {
    stop("Input must have at least three number")
  }
  
  z = (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)
  
  return(z)
  
}

z_scores(x_vec)
```

Try my function on some other things. These should give errors. 

```{r, error = TRUE}
z_scores(3)
z_scores("my name is jeff")
z_scores(mtcars)
z_scores(c(TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, FALSE))
```

## Multiple outputs 

```{r}
mean_and_sd = function(x) {
  
  if (!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("Input must be numeric")
  }
  
  if (length(x) < 3) {
    stop("Input must have at least three number")
  }
  
  mean_x = mean(x)
  sd_x = sd(x)
  
  tibble(
    mean = mean_x,
    sd = sd_x
  )

  
}

```

Check that the function works 

```{r}
x_vec = rnorm(100, mean = 3, sd = 4)
mean_and_sd(x_vec)
```

## Multiple inputs 

```{r}
sim_data = 
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(n = 100, mean = 4, sd = 3)
  )

sim_data %>% 
  summarize(
    mean = mean(x),
    sd = sd(x)
  )
```

```{r}
sim_mean_sd = function(sample_size, mu, sigma){
  sim_data = 
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(n = sample_size, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
  )
  
  sim_data %>% 
    summarize(
      mean = mean(x),
      sd = sd(x)
    )
}

sim_mean_sd(100, 6, 3)
```

```{r}
sim_mean_sd = function(sample_size, mu = 3 , sigma = 4){
  sim_data = 
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(n = sample_size, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
  )
  
  sim_data %>% 
    summarize(
      mean = mean(x),
      sd = sd(x)
    )
}

sim_mean_sd(sample_size = 100, mu = 6, sigma = 3)
sim_mean_sd( mu = 6, sample_size = 100, sigma = 3)

sim_mean_sd(sample_size = 100)
```
